options.name: [1] Surly
options.blurb: One of the state’s hottest brands, Surly was a major impetus behind the 2011 bill that allowed Minnesota breweries to open taprooms.

options.name: [16] Bad Weather
options.blurb: The 'untethered and unpredictable' beers made at St. Paul’s Bad Weather include the Windvane red IPA and the Sun Pillar Belgian blonde.

options.name: [2] Castle Danger
options.blurb: This Two Harbors operation is still growing but has gained a loyal following, thanks in part to its snazzy cans and flagship Cream Ale.

options.name: [15] Steel Toe
options.blurb: A St. Louis Park brewery that claims it has 'big dreams of staying small,' Steel Toe’s ale-heavy selection includes the popular Size 7 IPA.

options.name: [3] Bent Paddle
options.blurb: Stationed on the North Shore, Bent Paddle uses Lake Superior water and is known for its 'sessionable' or easy-drinking beers.

options.name: [14] Bauhaus
options.blurb: With German-inspired styles and a colorful Northeast Minneapolis taproom, Bauhaus sits in the heart of the Twin Cities craft brew scene.

options.name: [4] Schell's
options.blurb: Last year’s Ultimate Beer Bracket winner, Schell’s is the longest-running brewery in the state and one of the nation’s oldest.

options.name: [13] Junkyard
options.blurb: The pride of Moorhead, Junkyard has specialized in dark and malty, hoppy and sour beers – see the Experimental Passionfruit – since 2013.

options.name: [5] Summit
options.blurb: The well-loved Extra Pale Ale which was first brewed in 1986 – more than 30 years later Summit has proved to be tried and true.

options.name: [12] Fair State
options.blurb: Minnesota’s first co-op brewery, Fair State is as beloved for its beer – Roselle hibiscus sour, anyone – as its community connection.

options.name: [6] Dangerous Man
options.blurb: Debuting in 2013, Dangerous Man is known for its wide range of styles, from peanut butter porter to mango habanero milkshake IPA.

options.name: [11] Insight
options.blurb: Opening in 2015, fantastical brews – such as the Sunken City made with Saison and Sauv Blanc grapes – is the name of Insight’s game.

options.name: [7] Indeed
options.blurb: The first Northeast Minneapolis production brewery to open a taproom, Indeed is known for its Day Tripper pale ale, and its charitable backbone.

options.name: [10] Barrel Theory
options.blurb: Brand new to the game, Barrel Theory, known for its coconut milk stout, is nonetheless making waves since opening its doors last summer.

options.name: [8] Fulton
options.blurb: Boasting crowd favorites such as Lonely Blonde and Sweet Child of Vine, Minneapolis’ Fulton has become one of MN’s most recognizable brands.

options.name: [9] Lift Bridge
options.blurb: Since 2008, Stillwater-based Lift Bridge has honed its reputation with brews like its Farm Girl Saison – and also its non-alcoholic root beer.
